newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Three sticking points to EMU pact deal - minister.
newsitem.headline: Three sticking points to EMU pact deal - minister.

text.p: Three major issues remain for the European Union to reach an accord on the stability pact, an EU minister said on Sunday, adding that they were not major enough to prevent an agreement.
The minister, who asked not to be named, said the questions included whether or not to incorporate or annex a resolution on employment and growth to the pact.
Also at issue was whether to extend the remit of the European Investment Bank (EIB) to allow investment on education and small businesses.

The third issue was to clarify the relationship between the future European Central Bank and the so-called Stability Council that France wants as a counterbalance to pure economic control of monetary union.
The minister was speaking as EU finance ministers met to discuss the issue of meeting French concerns about employment and EMU-inspired budgetary rigour.
